newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest police hold 13, see end to bombings.
newsitem.headline: Budapest police hold 13, see end to bombings.

text.p: Hungary's top policemen said on Wednesday the recent arrest of 13 people suspected of illegal fuel sales and extortion could also bring an end to a wave of bombings which began last September.
"I trust that we can successfully bring the bombings to an end," national police chief Laszlo Forgach told a news conference.
Another police official said the bombings were devised to divert police attention from fuel tax and excise duty evasion amounting to billions of forints.

"Huge amounts of kerosene were traded evading taxes and we are in the process of following the thread to the end-users through the numerous links in the chain," said Colonel Istvan Miko of the National Police.
Police said earlier that almost two dozen explosions of grenades and petrol bombs, mainly in Budapest since September, were linked to an escalating gang turf war.
Forgach said threats against top police officials and of possible attacks on police premises since the April 27 arrests were a measure of police success against the criminals.
